page.title: 09Wildlife in Almondell,E.Cdr.
page.content: If you love animals and plants you will love Almondell. There is every kind of woodland animal.There are foxes,squirrels, badgers,rabbits and moles.The badgers could be in danger because of badger baiting. Badger baiting is done by sending a terrier dog down the badger's hole to fight. The mink has been driving otters out of their habitat.The Greater Spotted Woodpecker has often been seen in the park this summer.Kingfishers are often spotted near the sewage outfall. Fishing down Almondell is good.Trout is a popular catch and salmon have been coming up the river this year. The trees down Almondell are mostly deciduous- Horse Chestnut,Oak, Sycamore,Elm,Pine,Douglas Fir etc. Elms are dying out because of the Dutch Elm Disease.Helen & Carol-Anne
